content:
• Wednesday, July 3, 2013
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -3%) sold off for the second day in a row. This morning, GigaOm's Jordan Novet...

    Fusion-io (FIO -3%) sold off for the second day in a row. This morning, GigaOm's Jordan Novet provided a somewhat downbeat column about the company's prospects, making note of management upheaval and intensifying competition. "“I think they have a tough road to hoe," says analyst Howard Marks, noting the presence of rivals offering who are also trying to differentiate via value-added software, and the pending addition of a high-endurance feature offered by Fusion-io (atomic writes) into industry standards. Aside from its software efforts, Fusion-io counting on the low latencies of its costly ioDrive cards, and the very high densities of its cheaper ioScale cards, to help it stand out.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • RHI

    Temporary staffing firms were among the day's worst performers on the announced delay in...

    Temporary staffing firms were among the day's worst performers on the announced delay in enforcing the Obamacare requirement that large employers provide coverage for workers or pay a penalty. William Blair analysts say the removal of a catalyst for hiring temps is a big negative for Robert Half (RHI -5.2%). TrueBlue (TBI -0.3%) and On Assignment (ASGN -1.5%) also fell.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • PWRD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 2:15 p.m.: PWRD +3%. TDG +2%. CTRP +2%. OMAB +2%. BSMX +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 2:15 p.m.: PWRD +3%. TDG +2%. CTRP +2%. OMAB +2%. BSMX +2%.
    After-hours top losers: ARCP -2%. PBR -2%. NVAX -2%. COLE -2%. CS -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • SHLM

    A. Schulman (SHLM +3.6%) continued its bounce higher again today, regaining virtually all it...

    A. Schulman (SHLM +3.6%) continued its bounce higher again today, regaining virtually all it lost yesterday on the back of a dismal FQ3 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • APA

    One of today's big losers in the energy sector is Apache (APA -2.4%), which has assets in Egypt....

    One of today's big losers in the energy sector is Apache (APA -2.4%), which has assets in Egypt. Oppenheimer and others have warned APA's assets there have been a drag on valuation that's likely to get worse given the country’s "dysfunctional government, deteriorating economy, polarized society and exploding population." Shares have slipped ~4.5% this week vs. a 0.4% drop for S&P energy stocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • CORV

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME +7%) rises after announcing a 3-year agreement with AOP Orphan...

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME +7%) rises after announcing a 3-year agreement with AOP Orphan Pharmaceuticals AG to commercialize Brinavess in select European markets. Financial details of the agreement weren't disclosed. AOP Orphan will support CRME in getting the product registered for marketing and sales and will actively promote the product.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +4.9%) and Groupon (GRPN +1.6%) continue their recent rallies, possibly aided by...

    Zynga (ZNGA +4.9%) and Groupon (GRPN +1.6%) continue their recent rallies, possibly aided by favorable Jim Cramer mentions (video) during last night's episode of Mad Money. Cramer likes the accolades new Zynga CEO Don Mattrick is receiving from tech/media titans. "[Reid] Hoffman and [Jeffrey] Katzenberg? Both praising this guy? If this were really the Titanic of gaming, believe me these guys wouldn't be making these terrific comments." Regarding Groupon, Cramer suggests (like Wunderlich and Deutsche) the company is transforming itself in the post-Andrew Mason era (much of the groundwork was arguably laid when Mason was around). Zynga is up 23% over the last 3 trading days. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +3.2%) shares enjoy a solid gain despite J.P. Morgan's concerns about falling...

    Petrobras (PBR +3.2%) shares enjoy a solid gain despite J.P. Morgan's concerns about falling production; the firm estimates production must increase to ~2.08M bbl/day by year-end for PBR to meet its 2013 target of 1.98M. Even if all new projects start on schedule, the firm calculates no more than 170K bbl/day could be added by December, insufficient for PBR to meet its target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • ROAN

    Jim Cramer explains his quick turnaround on Linn Energy (LINE -14.1%) after yesterday's rout: "I...

    Jim Cramer explains his quick turnaround on Linn Energy (LINE -14.1%) after yesterday's rout: "I did like the company, but they're being examined... you can't have even examinations of accounting irregularities... accounting irregularities equals sell." As recently as June 19, Cramer had passionately defended the stock. LNCO -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 74 Comments
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +10.3%) jumps after SA contributor Natty Greene observes Glu's Chinese sales...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +10.3%) jumps after SA contributor Natty Greene observes Glu's Chinese sales are taking off, and suggest the company's Q2 revenue guidance of $17M "is going to be extremely conservative." Greene notes Glu has 4 games in App Annie's list of the top 100 grossing Chinese iOS games, including 3 in the top 30, and that both Chinese smartphone sales and gaming activity are taking off - Analysys expects the Chinese mobile gaming market to be worth $1.5B in 2013, and to host 336M gamers by 2015. Greene is also pleased with Glu's strong insider buying activity, and efforts to bring 3rd-party Chinese games to Western audiences.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • OILT

    Oiltanking Partners (OILT -1.6%) is downgraded to Underperform at BAML, which sees OILT's...

    Oiltanking Partners (OILT -1.6%) is downgraded to Underperform at BAML, which sees OILT's positive attributes as more than priced in. Despite OILT's high quality, fee-based asset base with attractive growth opportunities, under-levered balance sheet, strong and supportive parent, and relatively small size which could make acquisitions meaningful, BAML says the current premium valuation is not justified.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • RTN

    The Pentagon is planning its first missile test since 2008 on July 5. If successful, the launch...

    The Pentagon is planning its first missile test since 2008 on July 5. If successful, the launch will be the first interception in more than four years of a surrogate missile incoming toward the U.S. The test will use interceptors tipped with Raytheon (RTN +0.1%) "hit-to-kill" warheads which last successfully hit their target during a December 2008 exercise, and be operated by Boeing (BA +0.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 5 Comments
  • ITP

    Midday top 10 gainers: ONP +42%. UNTK +39%. PRAN +14%. ELX +14%. CHNR +13%. GLUU +11%. EDG +11%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: ONP +42%. UNTK +39%. PRAN +14%. ELX +14%. CHNR +13%. GLUU +11%. EDG +11%. GST +10%. DRRX +9%. ENVI +9%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: USMD -12%. LINE -10%. OSTK -9%. MJN -9%. ULTR -8%. LNCO -8%. ARP -8%. VNR -8%. ALDW -7%. USU -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • PRAN

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +14.9%) trades up after saying it's received approval from the Austin...

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +14.9%) trades up after saying it's received approval from the Austin Health Human Research Ethics Committee to begin a 12-month open-label extension study with Alzheimer's Disease patients. The study is part of a Phase II clinical trial of PBT2 in Alzheimer's patients, and will measure amyloid burden and physical changes in the brain through PET imaging, MRI and FDG-PET, as well as cognition and function.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 2 Comments
  • NDLS

    Noodles (NASDAQ:NDLS) is the new Chipotle as shares gain another 3.3% to move up 43% since...

    Noodles (NASDAQ:NDLS) is the new Chipotle as shares gain another 3.3% to move up 43% since debuting earlier this week. Assuming the restaurant chain strikes the same chord with consumers as its fast-casual role model, the trick to keep its lush restaurant-level margins might be rent costs. While McDonald's, Starbucks, and Dunkin' Brands have entrenched themselves with nice locations at 6% to 8% (of sales) costs - the path might not be as easy for Noodles as it looks to expand.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • CLF

    Goldman Sachs cuts its target price for Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -3%) to $16 from $21 while...

    Goldman Sachs cuts its target price for Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -3%) to $16 from $21 while lowering EPS estimates for Q2, Q3 and Q4. Cost reduction is easier said than done, the firm believes; cutting costs at Bloom Lake to its $65/metric ton target from ~$90 will be a tough path, even if CLF mothballs its Phase II expansion. CLF eventually could be forced to pullback from international operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • MDXG

    MiMedx Group (OTC:MDXG -5.7%) slips this morning after the company filed a $100.55M shelf...

    MiMedx Group (OTC:MDXG -5.7%) slips this morning after the company filed a $100.55M shelf registration statement to sell any combination of common and preferred stock, warrants and equity units. In addition, OTC:MDXG shareholders may offer for resale up to 7.5M shares of OTC:MDXG common stock owned by them under the shelf registration.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • ROAN

    It's shaping up as another difficult day for Linn Energy (LINE -9.3%) and LinnCo (LNCO -8%)...

    It's shaping up as another difficult day for Linn Energy (LINE -9.3%) and LinnCo (LNCO -8%) after yesterday's selloff. After a round of downgrades, Stifel Nicolaus today cut its price target on both to $33 from $48. Selling the put portfolio would not be a wise option, the firm says; Linn would shed some controversy but sacrifice possible future cash flow. Baird cautions broadly on upstream MLPs; BBEP -9%, ARP -7.1%, VNR -6.3%, QRE -6.2%, EVEP-OLD -3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 14 Comments
  • ELX

    Emulex (ELX +14.6%) soars after Bloomberg reports the company has hired Goldman to help find a...

    Emulex (ELX +14.6%) soars after Bloomberg reports the company has hired Goldman to help find a buyer. Activist investors Elliott Associates and Atlai Capital have been prodding the storage adapter card/switch vendor to sell itself. Archrival QLogic (QLGC +4.7%) has also jumped on the report. Both companies have been struggling to cope with weak server demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • MJN

    It's shaping up to be a rough day for shares of Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN -8.5%) as investors...

    It's shaping up to be a rough day for shares of Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN -8.5%) as investors react to a Chinese antitrust investigation and price cuts on formula products from Wyeth. Not helping matters is a downgrade to Neutral from Buy at Goldman.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.4%) jumps following an upgrade to Neutral from Macquarie's Kevin Smithen,...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.4%) jumps following an upgrade to Neutral from Macquarie's Kevin Smithen, which thinks the odds of a $10+/share acquisition by T-Mobile USA or Dish have grown. Smithen thinks the recent run-up in T-Mobile (NASDAQ:TMUS) shares has made a deal easier for the #4 U.S. carrier to swallow, and considers the concentration of Leap's equity in a few holders "both a catalyst and an obstacle for a sale." He cautions Leap's "already eroding operating business" could be further pressured by T-Mobile's plans to enter Leap markets (via MetroPCS), but adds it could "drive Leap's Board and key holders to sell now."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • IMMU

    Clivatuzumab "may offer an attractive alternative" for relapsed pancreatic cancer patients, a...

    Clivatuzumab "may offer an attractive alternative" for relapsed pancreatic cancer patients, a group for whom therapy options are limited, Immunomedics (IMMU -7.6%) says. The company calls results from a Phase 1b study "encouraging," and notes that "repeated cycles of yttrium-90 Clivatuzumab treatments extended survival when compared to a single cycle." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow the rest of the world lower, but have pared earlier...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow the rest of the world lower, but have pared earlier losses following a very decent ADP jobs report, with the S&P Mini -0.3%. Improving services PMI in much of the eurozone and the U.K. is being overshadowed by a conflagration of destabilizing news from elsewhere, particularly political instability in Portugal and Egypt, the latter sending oil +1.9%. Makes you want to pack up at lunchtime and take the day off tomorrow. Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, ISM Non-Manufacturing Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) is downgraded to Neutral from Overweight with a $9 price target, down from $12,...

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA) is downgraded to Neutral from Overweight with a $9 price target, down from $12, at J.P. Morgan, which says AA's efforts to cut costs in its upstream businesses likely will be overshadowed by persistently weak aluminum prices. Outside of a material rise in prices or significantly better investor sentiment, the firm sees few catalysts for AA shares in the near term. AA -2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • OCZ

    Premarket gainers: OCZ +6%. ELX +5%.

    Premarket gainers: OCZ +6%. ELX +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM

  • The decision by the World Bank to cut the economic growth forecast for Indonesia hits local...

    The decision by the World Bank to cut the economic growth forecast for Indonesia hits local shares (EIDO, IDX) hard as stocks fall 3.2% in Jakarta. Elsewhere in the region, foreign selling sends Thai (THD) equities 1.39% lower while the Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) falls 1.3%. Vietnamese (VNM), Malaysian (EWM), and Philippine (EPHE) shares are mixed.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM

  • Precious metals catch a bid amid Middle East worries and the reawakening of the EU debt crisis....

    Precious metals catch a bid amid Middle East worries and the reawakening of the EU debt crisis. Gold's ahead by 0.9% to $1,254/ounce and silver's up 2.5% to $19.78. GLD +1.1%, SLV +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 6 Comments
  • OSTK

    Bank of America slaps Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) with an Underperform rating on a valuation...

    Bank of America slaps Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) with an Underperform rating on a valuation call after shares of the online retailer doubled in less than three months. OSTK -3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • X

    Yesterday's rally in U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) on news that U.S. steel pipe makers are seeking...

    Yesterday's rally in U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) on news that U.S. steel pipe makers are seeking anti-dumping duties on nine countries is premature, Wells Fargo says, which notes that a final determination by the ITC can take over a year and the company's fundamentals remain challenging. Tenaris (NYSE:TS) also is pulling back following yesterday's late spike. X -2%, TS -3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM

  • Portuguese markets have gone into meltdown as the austerity induced political crisis threatens...

    Portuguese markets have gone into meltdown as the austerity induced political crisis threatens the government's existence. Local media reported that ministers from the CDS-PP, the ruling coalition's junior partner, are ready to follow their leader and Foreign Minister Paulo Portas out the door after he resigned yesterday. Portas' departure came after Finance Minister Vitor Gaspar quit on Monday. However, PM Pedro Passos Coelho is so far holding firm. The PSI 20 is -6.5%, 10-year bond yields spike to around 8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 AM
  • FEZ

    Asian and European (NYSEARCA:FEZ) stocks fall across the board, weighed down by a kaleidoscope...

    Asian and European (NYSEARCA:FEZ) stocks fall across the board, weighed down by a kaleidoscope of factors that includes tepid Chinese services PMI, caution ahead of the U.S. jobs report on Friday, massive unrest in Egypt, and trouble in Greece and Portugal. Japan -0.3%, Hong Kong -2.5%, China -0.6%, India -1.4%. EU Stoxx 50 -2%, London -1.6%, Paris -1.6%, Frankfurt -1.9%, Madrid -2.9%, Milan -1.7%, Portugal -6.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 AM
